content: miso coaster by erika westerop cello knits © 2014 i loved making this bowl coaster & it s a nice small project to use up your leftovers i used a larger needle than the yarn asks for because it turns out nicer when the coaster is felted donegal tweed is one of my favorite yarns even after felting t hose tiny tweedy dots are still visible f inished size = 17 cm as you can see in the photos herman and i had a great time during the photo session my noodle experience was cozy and herman actually e njoyed some seaweed happy crocheting popcorn materials the popcorn is formed by double crocheting 5 times in the donegal aran tweed 76 gram in total same stitch removing the hook 1 gram light blue 4805 = a from your 5th double_crochet loop 3 gram petrol blue 4847 = b inserting it through your first 26 gram brown grey 4801 = c double_crochet stitch and grabbing 46 gram warm grey 4742 = d the 5th double_crochet loop or any aran weight yarn -100% wool through the back and pulling it through you will then fasten the crochet needle 7 mm popcorn off by chaining one check youtube com for extra info tapestry needle abbreviations chain = chain round = round slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet popcorn = popcorn d irections with color a create a slip knot chain 2 six single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook c hange to color b & slip_stitch in first single_crochet to join round 1 chain 3 and create a popcorn in the same stitch as your chain 3 this means 4 more double_crochet & the chain 3 you already worked = 1st popcorn chain 1 to close popcorn 1pc in each single_crochet around = 6 popcorn in total change to color c & join with a slip_stitch into the bottom chain 3 of the 1st popcorn of this r nd round 2 chain 3 and create a popcorn in the same stitch as your chain 3 chain 1 to close popcorn another popcorn will be added to this section at end of round create 2 popcorn in space between the next 2 popcorn insert hook under chain that closed off the popcorn of previous round repeat this around and finish round 2 by adding 1 popcorn in the space where the 1st popcorn was made join with a slip_stitch into the bottom chain 3 of the 1st popcorn of this round 12 popcorn i n total round 3 chain 3 and create a popcorn in the same stitch as your chain 3 chain 1 to close popcorn another popcorn will be added to this section at end of round create 1 popcorn in next space 2 popcorn in next space 1 popcorn in next space 2 popcorn in next space etc finish round 2 by adding 1 popcorn in the space where the 1st
